Reviews.Title: “Quiet”
Reviews.Author: skip b
Reviews.Content: Nice for the price. No breakfast, Denny's on site with discount. Incredibly quitet given its prox to Traffic noise !! Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Over all, very good stay!”
Reviews.Author: Derfnikody
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 10 nights in February 2012, so I think I can give a very good review. We were from out of state visiting family in the area. First the good - Very comfortable beds. Some hotel beds are so hard you can't stay in one position for very long. These were wonderful beds, even "heavenly". Only problem was the woven blanket between the triple sheeting was a little stiff and scratchy. Softer blankets would be nice. Maybe they are very new and need to break in a little. Room was comfortable with nice furniture setup. Never felt cramped. Loved the free WIFI! Hotel grounds are immaculate! You could not find any chipped paint or beat up things anywhere. Very well maintained with beautiful landscaping. Excellent location to everything. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Price was excellent through Priceline. Try it!!! Not so good - Being close to freeway (good and bad) can be noisy. Get in the tower suite area. Much quieter. Also parking can be difficult. We came back every evening after 10 and had difficulty finding parking spots. Try to get top floor. Several nights we heard people running around till almost midnight above us. Also shower has one of those saver heads. It was also positioned so high on the wall, it was a trickle by the time it hit you. And we are tall. Several times we smelled cigarette smoke. Finally last time, my husband went outside and found a guy smoking on top floor balcony, flicking his butts off to right near our air conditioning. Nice little pile was building up. Wasn't hotel's fault but irksome, nevertheless. Made our room stink. Overall a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't count on customer loyalty or even a manager who cares!”
Reviews.Author: Barbara B
Reviews.Content: We stay here regularly. Accommodations are lovely; Place is clean. Staff is excellent---better than the management deserves. The issue: No customer loyalty: (1) no special rates for regulars (those of us who stay every few months) but they give special rates to "one-timers", those who get special deals from airlines, etc.; (2) manager Eddie does not believe in seeing anyone who wants to talk to him. He keeps you waiting while he talks on the phone until you simply walk away! Best Western needs to take a look at its policy and its manager! I've written a complaint to Best Western Headquarters. Let's see if they care more than manager Eddie!

Reviews.Title: “Located away from stores or restaurants”
Reviews.Author: kanasri
Reviews.Content: Hotel is distant from stores or restaurants. The only restaurant near by is a Denny's, that is if you like eating here. They only work with 1 tour operator so if you want help with reservations, you are on your own or use the only company they use. If book, you can't cancel within 24 hours while all other hotels allow you until 4pm of day of arrival but not here. Staff don't help with anything, they do bare minimum. All tour companies don't pick up at this hotel. This hotel is more than 45 minutes from LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Nice Pool Decent room”
Reviews.Author: TorontoIcecream
Reviews.Content: I had a first floor room which was great. Always had a parking spot in front of my room. The room was a decent size however the shower and toilet felt a bit small. I was no impressed with the showers water flow and it took about 3-4 minutes for the warm /hot water to come on. The door is a sliding door and it gets stuck, will be awkward if you are traveling with someone else. The room was made up nicely every day with towels ready. The bed was comfortable and so were the pillows. Other readers complained about the noise but it did not bother me at all. There are several of places to get a snack in walking distance and a target near by. The 405 is a turn away and you are minutes away from Downtown L.A, Universal Studios which works out great. I only went to the pool area one day but did not go in the water due to winds but I was relaxing on a lounge chair. I did not need them much but the people at the front desk were friendly as the check in and out process went smoothly. I would return to the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: cgm95
Reviews.Content: We were attending an event at Warner Brothers studios so we decided to pick this Best Western because it is only about six miles away from the studio. (We arrived about four hours prior to check-in time and they got us a room right away.) The property is beautiful, the front desk staff pleasant and helpful (with directions on getting onto the freeway to Burbank), the room was clean and spacious. It is right next to a Dennys Diner where we had three excellent meals with great service. Overall, we were very pleased with the experience. There are a couple downsides, first being that it is right off the 405 freeway which creates a continuous hum of traffic. It's not really that bad -- more like loud white noise that helped drown out the gaggle of giggling girls that checked in next door at about 11:00 p.m. one night without any inkling that -- yes, at that hour -- people would be trying to sleep. The sound of these neighbors came through the doors that could link our two rooms. The doors were so thin (or the sealing around the doors so poor) that it sounded like these giggling girls were in our room. The inconsiderate guests next door is not the fault of the hotel; but the poor soundproofing around those doors is. That said, we enjoyed our two nights and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but not quiet!”
Reviews.Author: bbbob84
Reviews.Content: While the room was clean, but dated, it was on a main thoroughfare with a lot of noise. Firetrucks, Police Cars and Ambulances responding to emergencies. Bus and truck traffic going by day and night. Request a room away from the Denny's so you do not need to hear the garbage truck picking up early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all the way”
Reviews.Author: Deborah B
Reviews.Content: No complaints here! I booked through Expedia, then called to be sure I was in a pet allowed room. Reservation hadn't come in yet, but Monica at front desk called back to let me know when it did & that all was in order. When I checked in, she remembered me & volunteered info to make stay w/cat more comfortable. My room was upgraded at no charge. Anna in housekeeping was quite solicitious about my injured cat & very friendly. Room clean, comfy & convenient. Plan to return next week:-)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Quiet, Good value”
Reviews.Author: mahavir_49
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in august '11. The check in time was too long. Only 2 people and too many guests waiting for check in - disaster. Got the rooms after 45 mins. The room itself was quite good. It was a king bed. It was comfortable. Interiors were ok. The location was perfect for us since we were visiting universal studios and hollywood which are quite close by. The room comes with all necessary amenities like fridge, microwave, phone, tv. They had a safe for additional $1 a day. We recommend it. Ours went bad the first night, so called the front desk and batteries were replaced promptly. They have denny's on property that gives 20% discount if you are staying there. Parking is good but it gets full pretty quickly. Very hard to find parking spot if you come late. Overall a great stay at great price in LA. I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Items Stolen From Room”
Reviews.Author: JMilesMiller
Reviews.Content: Someone stole $130 worth of clothing from my room. I told the manager and he just repeated himself that he knows his staff and they wouldn't do that. All I know is I had the clothes hanging in the closet and then they were gone.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, but no sleep”
Reviews.Author: H C
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and nice. The service was kind and helpful. I liked the idea of non-smoking for all rooms. We paid half price, which seemed like a great deal. However, our room (528) was on the third floor right next to the freeway. Since we were at freeway level, there was no noise buffer and we didn't sleep much at all! Saddly, there was a crack between the door and jamb that drew in the smoke from people smoking outside. So we got a fair amount of cigarette smoke too. The pool was clean and had towels at poolside. The jacuzzi was also reasonably clean (leaves only) but was not wheelchair accessible because cars are allowed to park in front of it. So I left the wheelchair in the parking lot and carried my 80 daughter to the jacuzzi, squeezing around parked cars. I would only stay again if I knew my room was a quieter, less smokey one.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ron M
Reviews.Content: Good big size and clean regular room. 10% disscount at Danny's which is 1 minute walk from the room's door step. There is also a computer with internet connection in the lobby (free to use). The location of the motel is best to avoid inner-city traffic. Santa Monica, Venice Beach and Beverly Hills - only 15-25 min drive and Disneyland ~ aprrox. 50 min (If you get up early - 6AM).

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Tracy L
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel in the Denny's free magazine and although we didn't get the cheap rate we were pleased with the room and were happy to pay an extra $20. The room was large, clean and had a comfortable bed. We could hear the traffic as we were on the road side but we managed to sleep ok. The pool and jacuzzi were nice after a day out and with Denny's right next door dinner was within easy reach.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: 8Celia2
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location, great people. Free parking although hard to find a spot at times.

Reviews.Title: “Safe and Secure Hotel in LA near Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: chelseasly
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very safe and clean. It was a short drive to Hollywood attractions. The room we stayed in was noisy from traffic but we were warned of this. I didn't want to wait past 3pm to check in to one of the more quiet rooms. Fridge and safe were offered.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location with clean rooms and reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: Raza S
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in Room 306 (1st floor, 2 queen beds, non-smoking). There is a Denny's on the premises, which is very convenient; they even have a discount for hotel guests. For the 1st time ever, I had forgotten my shaving razor; when requested, they sent a razor and shaving foam as well. At the time of check-in, the staff also gave me the password for free wireless internet, though I did not bring my laptop and cannot say anything about it. I found the place quite reasonable and well-priced. There is one issue though: the hotel is flanked by I-405 on one side and the busy Sepulveda Blvd (where my room was) on the other. Noise turned out to be a problem. I could have asked for a room away from the 2 sides, but I decided it was not so bad. If not for the noise, I would have given it a 4 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for a stopover.”
Reviews.Author: Werner L
Reviews.Content: A good choice for a stopover. Conveniently located between Burbank and LA it was a good choice for a night. It was an older hotel with some older furniture yet it was clean and well maintained. It's location is odd sitting behind a Denny's restaurant, but don't let that bother you, the place is O.K. for a night.

Reviews.Title: “Good finding!”
Reviews.Author: gabysb
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is perfect for visits to Universal Studio, Hollywood and Santa Monica. It's close to both 405 and 101 freeways but, on the negative side, it gets noisy during the night. The 405 freeway is just behind the hotel and the noise can be a problem. The room is very spacious and spotless with clean bathroom with two sinks. They boasts to have the cleanest rooms in the neighbourhood. Internet is free, there are coffee making and ironing facilities (the house coffee is not so good). The safe is at a charge, we paid around 10 dollars for 2 weeks. The fridge can be noisy during the night. The A/C worked very well during the day. It gets cooler during the night, so it was no need for it then. I used the laundry room @ 2 dollars a load for washing or drying machines. The pool is clean and on the small side. It tends to be crowded with children especially in the evenings. The only minor problem is the parking space since the hotel is always crowded. In two weeks, only once we couldn't find a space available. I didn't try the breakfast or the Denny's restaurant on site. Staff at the reception desk is friendly and polite. Overall, I would stay again here since the price was very decent for what the hotel offers.

Reviews.Title: “Best in the area!”
Reviews.Author: WanaBinHawaii
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel numerous times over the past 20 years and it's always been a pleasant experience. There is a Denny's on the property, so that's convenient for quick meals. Be sure to mention you're a guest of the hotel and they'll give you 10% off your bill. The room was very comfortable and the bathroom was great - two sinks . . . one in the tub area and one in the dressing room area!! I was a little skeptical when I saw the room was next to the tunnel leading to the suites tower and parking area behind us because I've had a bad experience with that kind of thing at another hotel, but I didn't hear a sound! The hotel is very well kept and landscaping is beautiful. The only problem was upon our return from our event on Saturday night around 11:30 pm and there were no parking spots in their lot or on the street! We appreciated the front desk employee on duty giving us permission to park in a no parking area. Would we stay there again? Absolutely! Thank you, BW Carriage Inn!!

Reviews.Title: “older but solid”
Reviews.Author: FishinOregon
Reviews.Content: This Best Western Plus is an older hotel, remodeled and located directly next to the busy 405 freeway. Because the hotel was well built, you don't really hear much from the freeway, unless you step outside your room. If you use the pool or hot tub, you are subjected to the noise of the 405 freeway. For 2 adults and 2 children, we booked a double queen room. While the room was clean and well stocked with frig., hair dryer, iron, ironing board, safe, towles, coffee, soap and the like, the room itself was rather small. There's a Denny's restaruant on the property and guests at the hotel receive 10% off their order. They even have room service. While Denny's not not my favorite we all enjoyed a good breakfast there. Folks at the hotel front desk are friendly and inviting and the maid service was great. As far as cost, we actually expected a better hotel for the price we paid. I feel there are better values around if your looking for a Best Western in the Valley. Happy traveling!

Reviews.Title: “If you can't nail it down don't leave it in your room”
Reviews.Author: Zesty1966
Reviews.Content: The location is fine but a bit off the beaten track. The staff are friendly enough and the general standard of the rooms is quite good considering the 1st impressions. However be warned. We were three families in three rooms and had stuff stolen from open suitcases or the room. My advise to anyone staying here would be to lock all valuables in the safe and then lock all clothing and belongings away if leaving your room for any period of time. Our friends lost clothing from open suitcases and the others lost shoes that had been left out. Left a sour taste in our mouths at the start of a holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: l1eve
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for only 1 night. The hotel is located next to the 405; very central and easy to get where you want to go in the area. The next day we planned a visit to Universal Studios, which was about 20mins drive. Reception was friendly and helpfull. There is a small pool area near the reception which looked ok. The rooms were very spacious, well isolated and clean. Free wifi available. There is no breakfast included, but there is a Denny's on site.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place at a great location!”
Reviews.Author: RichThornton_11
Reviews.Content: Planning a one week trip to a place we hadn't been to as a family before was a daunting task. Read lots and lots of reviews and finally decided on this place based on what I hoped it would be like, the location in relationship to where we planned to visit, and the good price for the room. Flew into LA airport and headed for the hotel and it was very easy to find, right off an exit. The staff made check-in quick and answered questions about the place we were heading the next day. We checked into our room and were glad about how nice it was. Throughout our one week stay we traveled to Los Angeles, Hollywood, Burbank, Santa Monica, Malibu, and more and because of its location near two major highways it was convenient to leave from and get back to. We ate breakfast several mornings in the Denny's that was on the property and that was very convenient. The wireless internet in the room worked well and I also used the hotel computer in the lobby a few times. The only thing that worked quirky was the elevator at times, but everything has its ups and downs. There was even a Target store within a block and a church we went to that was in easy driving distance. We had a great time in the Los Angeles area and would definitely stay here again. Great and very helpful staff, nice room, fair price, and great location.

Reviews.Title: “I will not be back to this Place”
Reviews.Author: Escano777
Reviews.Content: This is an inexpensive Motel. The photos of the place look much better than the actual hotel. I asked for a non-smoking room but the room smelled like an ashtray even after they cleaned it. I was offered another room but based on the look of the place I had a feeling that no room would be to my satisfaction. I cannot recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Too much money for this worn out hotel”
Reviews.Author: goyankees1962
Reviews.Content: Went for one night to this Hotel after we left Universal Studios Hollywood, (10 minute ride) They charged $147 for the night. Now I will sat the room was in good condition altough they didnt provide comforters in the room for the beds ( According to them, its Best Westerns policy). We were given room 401, 2nd floor in the building in the back, wich unfortunatley for us , was right next to Sepulveda Blvd, so we heard every siren, and all traffic all night. Now the building we were in was clean inside ( had a "just Shampooed" smell in the hallways, The elevators were ridiculous, you had to hit both the up and down buttons to get the elevator to come to your floor, and once you got in them, you felt that it might not make it to the floor as it vibrated badly. One other thing about this property, In the room there are MULTIPLE signed in the room that every item is counted (towels, iron, ironing board, blankets) and if anything is missing you will be held responsible, If your room smell of cigarrette smoke, you will be charged $250, and it goes on and on. might have been better as you checked out to just to have them say "Stop thief" ! Ridiculous! We didnt go to the Dennys on the property, and Parking was so tight I had truble negotiating my vehichle out of the lot. I would not reccommend this hotel unless you paid less than $70 a night, that is all it is worth and not a penny more

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: ZoeJVB
Reviews.Content: This was a great find for us. We changed hotels at the last minute as we werent sure about the one we had booked, and we didnâ€™t regret it. The room was really spacious and clean. It was well turned out with two sinks, a spacious dressing area and a comfy bed; as well as the added bonus of a fridge and microwave. The pool area was really nice and well kept, and unlike most roadside hotels, was well screened from the road and parking lot. The gym was also handy, as was the laundry - also good signal on the wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Good Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LATraveler01
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for the location. I needed to be close to Simi Valley and Studio City. This hotel is right off the Burbank Exit. Easy on and off! After reading some of the reviews I was a little nervous about booking this hotel but I was surprised. There are 3 sections to this complex. My room was the deluxe King room. Excellent room: Comfy bed, clean room, and plenty of towels. My room also had a frig and a fully working tv. (some of th reviews said theirs wasn't working). There was plenty of free parking and never had a problem finding a spot close to my door. I booked this for a place to sleep. I wanted to go the pool but it was packed with loud kids all 3 days I was there. The only thing missing was having breakfast included. There is a Dennys on site. The service sucked but the food was good. They need to have more people working there. I only counted 3 people working during busy dinner time. I only got 1 meal there, because it was late and didn't want to drive around. There are lots of places around to eat at as well. Sherman Oaks Galleria is 4 blocks away, as well as the big mall off Woodman Ave and the 101. If you are going to be there for a vaction and will be in the room with kids. You may want to look elsewhere. This is not a kid friendly hotel. It is in a very busy area. If you looking for a great nights sleep without too much hassle then you will be happy. When I need a hotel in the valley I will be back...good hotel. I booked on Hotwire and got a steal on the room. I don't know if 100+ a night is worth it. There are always online specials to a great deal here.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best choice i made!”
Reviews.Author: Masha1977
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not THAT bad, but could be better. Too many little problems: like full parking, no free breakfast, bunch of weird youg people fulling around, rooms are not too clean, not everything working, noisy, limited hours for gym & laundry, everything is kind of worn out, pool & jacuzzi don't look clean at all. However, it has a lot of good restaurants very close. Go to Chesecake Factory for breakfast, not Danny's! :)

Reviews.Title: “Expensive "MOTEL 6"!”
Reviews.Author: d3jsk
Reviews.Content: Don't let other reviews fool you. Only thing missing at this hotel was the prostitutes. Even they know it is too expensive! This hotel has Motel 6 features at a Hyatt or Marriott price. NEVER been more disappointed! NEVER written a review before! Hard box bed of the cheapest motels; paper thin carpet with every undulation available to your feet (assuming you aren't smart enough to wear slippers on the filthy carpet); Dirty bathroom floor; and as is most telling of a cheap motel, no toiletries such as shampoo and lotion, etc. I would expect these exquisite features if I paid $40-50, but not from a $110 plus hotel. Area is sketchy at best. Check it on Google Earth if you doubt it! Parking dangerous and atrocious.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for a mid-range hotel, helpful desk staff, superior bed!”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda123itsme
Reviews.Content: I made our reservations through the 800 number and he was very helpful. We stayed in a King room (club chair w/ottoman, desk, microwave/fridge, double sinks) for two weeks while visiting family, friends and sightseeing. In the reception room there is a high quality coffee maker where I'd go each morning for a better cup of coffee for each of us and a copy of USA Today and/or the LA Times. There is a computer station with printer (free) and the reception staff would send and receive faxes for us at no additional charge. The bed was excellent, extremely comfortable with good linens. The outdoor jacuzzi was great except someone had put in bubble bath and it felt like a giant bathtub for toddlers. The laundry facilities ($5.25 for wash, dry and soap) are very clean. The parking lot is well lit all night and feels secure. The in-room safe was an additional $1.50 per day. The staff is friendly and helpful. There is an excellent breakfast/lunch restaurant caddy corner to the hotel, next to the gas station called Arnie's. They have the BEST chocolate-dipped chocolate chip biscotti that I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: angel0812
Reviews.Content: Me and my family had our special bonding here at Best Western Carriage Inn. My kids enjoyed their food and drinks, as well as my husband when we had our dinner there. The Staff were very accommodating. They will help you with the concerns and problems that you might have and will assist you on how to make your stay there worthwhile. I found out that we can enjoy more our stay here just by typing the keyword WEEKEND then send to 21534. We were able to get the prices at a discounted rate. The longer the duration, the more memorable things could be.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good stay!”
Reviews.Author: TeachinNV
Reviews.Content: My 18-year old niece and I just returned from a 5-night stay at the Carriage Inn, and overall, we were pleased with our stay. Pros: Clean, comfortable, and quiet room with 2 queen-sized beds, loads of pillows, large TV, and mini-fridge Quick, reliable elevators Very nice front desk staff! Denny's Restaurant next door (room service delivered from there) Good location: near the 101 and 405 freeways; easy access to Universal Studios, Hollywood Blvd., and beaches. Cons: Not enough towels (even though I left a note each day to ask for a couple of extra); in fact, the housekeeping staff was kind of hit or miss from day to day. Not enough water pressure in the shower Ridiculously small trash cans in the room and bathroom No other restaurants within walking distance Overall, we had a good experience, and will definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: scottgenevaDenver
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Carriage Inn. Well maintained property. Room was comfortable. I had a coupon from one of those interstate motel travel guides. The front desk honored the coupon even tho there were only a few rooms remaining. Front desk staff were very considerate. Above average Denny's attached to the property.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel .. Awesome Staff”
Reviews.Author: Matt_in_US
Reviews.Content: Let me say it from the start - I have stayed in a LOT of hotels and so I have pretty reasonable expectations when I stay somewhere. This place really exceeded those expectations and it goes to show what owners who care can do. The rooms were clean and well maintained (and the place has seen a lot of remodeling lately). The staff were extremely friendly and were empowered to make decisions to improve your stay. I stayed with my wife, in-laws and two very small children. Where other places insisted we take two rooms the carriage inn had no problems with us bringing our own crib and an air mattress for my other son. The room was certainly big enough to host it. The hot-tub was nice and clean and tucked away where it would not disturb guests. We had one issue with the cleaner leaving our door ajar one day. Nothing was taken but the management took it very seriously and took the audit log from the door lock to follow up. They then gave us free breakfast vouchers for Denny's which is in the same complex. This place is in a very nice area of town (safe) and is a short walk to Target to do some shopping. It's also not far (by car) to Universal Studios (which is where we were going). All in all - a pleasant stay that we really enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up!!!”
Reviews.Author: LisaRmro
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the BW Carriage Inn on Jan 29th-30th, we went with a large group for my son's baseball tournament. After reading some bad reviews, I was a little leary of what to expect. Overall experience was good. We had a late check-in around 6pm, front desk staff was very friendly. I asked them about the ammenties of the hotel such as the laundry facility to wash baseball clothes and asked for my room to be near the facility. They gave me a room on the upper lever right above the laundry facility and vending machines. Also they asked if i would like the code for their Free Wi-Fi, which was great. Room was very clean, and bathroom as well (a little outdated but we just needed it for one night not a family vacation resort). There was a T.V., desk, 2 beds (non-smoking), refrigerator, and coffe pot. Bathroom was fully stocked with towels and tolietries. My only complaint in bathroom was no fan so when showering it got pretty steamy in there. Also we used the heated pool, the kids loved that. All the parents ordered pizza so we just hung out there pretty much of the night. There is a Denny's on permisses with a bar for the grown folks. Overall our stay was pleasant. The walls are thin so i did hear the neighbors every time they turn the sink, or shower on. But it was managable. Did not hear the freeway as I expected to from the reviews. Bedtime was pleasant. Overall it got the job done, and if I were to be in the neighborhood again, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “"Best" Best Western ever -- for me”
Reviews.Author: Hags_10
Reviews.Content: I usually avoid Best Westerns. I was very pleasantly surprised by this one. Very convenient to the highways (101 and 405). Very clean and well kept. The staff could not have been nicer. Best of all, the price was right. Also, It had a Denny's restaurant on-site which I used for breakfast. If you are looking for a decent, clean place to stay for a good price in Sherman Oaks, this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great price for location, pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: sunnyWashingtonstate
Reviews.Content: I had read some reviews that this hotel was tired and worn. I really needed this hotel for location and price so I decided to have faith in the Best Western brand. I was not disappointed in the least. If you have stayed in LA before, you know how expensive hotels can be. You could tell property was older but it was clean. Front desk staff was very friendly and helpful.This hotel was reasonable and had ample parking which if you have ever had to park at LA hotels you will understand this. Hotel close to all major freeways and close to shopping like Costco and Target.Room was comfortable and homey. Room had frig and coffee maker. Denny's was right on property which made getting anything to eat easy. Pool was pleasant also. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable; well located; friendly, competent staff;meticulously clean!”
Reviews.Author: TucsonBruja
Reviews.Content: We love this Best Western! It offers all of the amenities of all Best Westerns but this one seems to go beyond! The staff is competent, cheerful, friendly. Parking is ample. The rooms are beautifully appointed and very comfortable. The location of the motel is perfect: right near both the San Diego (405) Freeway and the Hollywood (101) Freeway. You just feel really safe here! The one thing it lacks is breakfast, but there's a Denny's next door and it's more than adequate. When we're in Los Angeles, we love staying at Best Western Carriage Inn. We have no hesitation to recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: baobaobeibei88
Reviews.Content: though it rated as 3-star hotel, it feels like a 2-star one, and not even a good 2-star. the rooms and facilitied are old and dirty, the bed is not comfortable at all.

Reviews.Title: “Average rooms, but great location.”
Reviews.Author: emuhlee44
Reviews.Content: Here are the upsides: close to the 101 and 405 freeways, steps away from Denny's, and easy access to gas stations. Attendants will also match on-line room prices if you mention it. Downsides: customer service is just okay, the lock to my bathroom door didn't work, and the heater gave off a burning smell.

Reviews.Title: “Great Guest Service!”
Reviews.Author: aspenhairdresser
Reviews.Content: This is a comfortable property with all the "bells and whistles" for a reasonable price. Nice neighborhood with easy access to local attractions. Excellent guest services!!! I was so impressed how the manager went out of his way to answer my questions about the area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, One of the cleanest rooms we've stayed in recently.”
Reviews.Author: CheshireRexxie
Reviews.Content: This hotel deserves better recognition as it was very clean, comfortable and quiet. We checked in for only 1 night, but due to the high standards (clean rooms) we booked another night. Our room was away from the noisy highway Room T409. The hotel was full and speaking to other people they seemed very pleased with how clean this hotel was. They wash the carpets each day and the mattress was clean and looked new. The towels were of good quality and the toiletries were not the cheapest. They do take pride in their hotel so this is why I do strongly recommend it. The staff were very friendly and helpful. This hotel is as it states the cleanest hotel around.

Reviews.Title: “No better than a Motel 6, NOISY parking lot, outdated rooms. bad neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: lovetucsonweather
Reviews.Content: I am unsure why other reviewers would think this hotel is a good deal. i stay often in LA, and this hotel is a dump. The area is bad, and the 24 hr Dennys attracts loud patrons all hours of the night. This is a motor inn, the rooms above and around the parking lot. Build before the days of car alarms and loud stereos. I was up all night with slamming doors (paper thin doors and walls), ac unit in the back of the room- so no help drowing out the noise. What a disaster..I woke up to look outside many times to ensure my car had not been broken into. Its a bad neighborhood, I should have known better- but I was tired and needed a place. Went to Marriott Culver City for ten bucks more, and that was a safe and beautiful hotel. The staff was not very nice either, they charged me two nights,even after I called in the morning to say I could not stay another night due to loud noise and no sleep. Rubbing salt in the wound would be an understatement. Be safe and rested, dont stay here. There was not 1 good quality of this hotel..ok maybe one, free parking.

Reviews.Title: “If your only conern is proximity to Santa Monica and the price then stay here.”
Reviews.Author: AQMRN
Reviews.Content: The title says it all. We would not stay in this BW again unless money and proximity to the Interstate is the object. The parking lot is crowded and difficult to navigate (very narrow slots). The check-in was awkward at best as was the guy who checked us in: weird questions, long wait, mistakes with printing receipts, overall, not very reassurring. The rooms are very unusually decorated (look at their pics on the BW website), their really look like your grandma's bedroom. The floors were wet as if someone had just spilled water there. The odor was musky. The nearby interstate made it for one of the noisiest places we have recently visited (ask to sleep on the side away from the highway). The rooms needed redecorating, the grounds could use some cleaning. In sum, skip it if you can afford better. AQMRN

Reviews.Title: “AVOID”
Reviews.Author: Jimimhendrix
Reviews.Content: This Best Western has many problems - situated next next to a noisy street, a 24-hour Denny's where people pull up with noisy radios blasting... Somebody was even shouting in the parking lot around 10 pm, and hookers walking the street. What really ticked me off was no hot water to take a shower in the morning. I let it run for about 2 minutes - just a hint of heat. The sinks were slightly better.. When I complained about it to Abpu at the front desk, he called his manager Anthony Pagtalunan. He nodded his head, ans said I should have gave it five min. I siad you should have a sign then. He said if I wanted to return he'd put me up in their "Tower Section" - which is actually just three floors compared to two. "The plumbing is better there," he said. "It was built in the 1970s, as opposed to the 1960s where the two-story rooms are." His theory on 30 year plumbing vs 40, may be correct, but I never wanted to see this place again and something back for what I paid. Pagtaunan offered me a $10 refund, but after seeing I prepaid through hotels.com, he couldn't help. The best he could offer me was a free $4 breakfast at Denny's. Don't stay here - ever!

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough”
Reviews.Author: rag_j
Reviews.Content: Slightly overpriced, comfortable stay, okayish staff, quiet surroundings, nice rooms and interiors.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to LA sights.”
Reviews.Author: Loveyogaandtravel
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to stay 5 nights, but only ended up staying 2 because our plans fell through. Though we didn't get the full effect of the stay, I could tell right away that this was a good choice for staying in the LA area and accessing the freeways. We didn't use the pool, however the hottub was very comfortable and relaxing. Our room was very comfortable and spacious, too. Oh - and the fridge was a nice and unexpected perk. The street noise might be bothersome to other guests, however we found it a bit like having white noise and helped up sleep - we're from another busy city so it was suitable for us. The prices and staff were impressive. It was a great 2 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “good location right off 405”
Reviews.Author: marill2
Reviews.Content: Very clean. Ask for a room that doesn't back onto the 405-would be noisy. We stayed in room 207-quiet here. One of the two sinks was out of order, but probably will be fixed soon. Easy on to 405 and the 101.

Reviews.Title: “Just the right location!”
Reviews.Author: agreatdesigner
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Southern Calif. a few weeks ago and stayed at the Carriage House Inn. We had friends and relatives on both sides of LA so we needed to be able to hop onto just about any freeway to get to them. This hotel is actually located in "the valley" but the 101, 405 and 118 are all close by. The room was nice and clean. We had requested the quiet side of the building and they providing that service even though we didn't arrive until 11pm and the hotel was booked solid.! There is a Target store right down the street for forgotten clothing or sundries that you may need. WE didn't use the pool as we were on the road every day but it looked nice as did the separate hot tub. Also, if necessary, there is a Denny's restaurant right there for a late night bite...or even a sundae :-)

Reviews.Title: “clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: koalasoup
Reviews.Content: A handy location to see all the attractions. reasonably priced and efficient staff.. my advise would be to make sure you get a room in the tower building as the motel is right beside the freeway and the other rooms can be noisy

Reviews.Title: “Close to all the attactions”
Reviews.Author: iva_van
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights. The hotel was very clean but the furniture was a little bit dated. The location is great - it is very close to all the attractions - Getty Centre, Hollywood, Beverly Hills, Universal Studios, the beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK if you have no high expectations”
Reviews.Author: BobbyNL
Reviews.Content: On the internet photo's it looks more like an hotel, but it's actually a real inn, so that was something I didn't expect. Further the rooms are a bit dated, but clean and fresh. The location is ok, but not very perfect, I expected it more in a quiet area, this ones is a bit busy. So if you want a good inn for a bit more money and you don't want to stay longer than 2 days, you can consider this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms and proximity to attractions.”
Reviews.Author: devilzzzangel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days in July,08 heading from SFO and heading to Vegas. The rooms were nice and the beds were comfortable. The proximity to tourist attractions like hollywood was an added advantage. The rooms that we stayed in wasn't noisy at all. On the contrary it was quite peaceful. The only weak point was that it was slightly overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, no frills, good option for budget minded business traveler”
Reviews.Author: Chris1stVA
Reviews.Content: Most Best Westerns on the East Coast are two star at best, and many would be a generous one star. While this property has clearly been around for a while, they have done a good job keeping it clean, giving it a solid 2 2/3 stars in my book. Pros: Affordable option right next to the 405. Bed was comfortable, they had 4 ESPN stations, refrigerator in room. Staff was polite. Denny's on site - though I didn't eat there. Cons: You are right next to the 405. If you are a very light sleeper the road noise may get to you. I personally had no issues. The room was non-smoking, but clearly that had not always been the case. Other than the Denny's, there aren't many food or beverage options close by.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot for sight seeing”
Reviews.Author: DublinDolphin
Reviews.Content: Hotel was convenient for both Santa Monica and the Hollywood sign, Beverly Hills etc. They are about 30 minute drive. Rooms were fine and clean. It is right beside the motorway and you can here the noise in the rooms we had no problem sleeping at all. The only thing compared to the other Best Western was there was no breakfast included but it is beside a Denny's so you can eat there. We got the hotel at a good price and I would stay there again. There is also a small pool if you like to sit out for a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: lucks27
Reviews.Content: I have never been to LA before and did not know what to expect. The hotel was clean and has parking, which was a major plus. A lot of the hotels charged between 15-25 a night for parking. Also there is a target within walking distance, which was great for items we forgot. I read complaints about the road noise. Our room was on corner of the exit ramp for the highway. We definetely heard cars and trucks, but we are staying in a city. Sort of expected. For the price, I thought the hotel is a great value and would definetely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in a pleasant setting”
Reviews.Author: Jackson55
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the BW Carriage Inn and were very pleased with the experience. The building is a very well-maintained older motel, and it was nice not to be in a cookie-cutter chain property. Our room was in the rear, behind the lobby/restaurant building -- no view, but very quiet. The room was obviously recently renovated, attractively so, and was very clean and well maintained. Service at the front desk was pleasant and helpful. The attached Denny's restaurant, while hardly upscale, had very attentive staff and good food. The location offers easy access to I-405, Burbank Airport, Beverly Hills/Hollyswood, etc. At $82 a night, it was a great value and offered quality, if not luxury, for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: stairway2heaven
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels and when you complain to management about the room, they immediately switch your room if it's available. Not so at Best Western. Here, management, having been called by me at midnight regarding excessively loud TV next door, comes at 12:30, knocks on the offending door, gets no response and starts walking away. I call him into my room to hear how audible the TV is in my room and his response is that it was not that bad. At 2:30 A.M. I finally got dressed and went to lie down on the couch by the front desk. A half hour later, now 3 A.M., he offers another room. Too little, too late. Now, not only is that whole night ruined, but my schedule will be off for days. I will be staying away from all Best Westerns and advise you to do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel , big (180 rooms)”
Reviews.Author: dng08
Reviews.Content: Very clean. Average + size room. Equipped with refrigerator, coffee machine , TV. free wireless internet + free internet at the reception. Free parking. Denny's restaurant locate at the hotel open 24. Vending machins Swimming pool, Jacuzzi We paid 100$ per night, stayed 4 nights. locate almost on the intersection of 101 $ 405 free way.

Reviews.Title: “Good value motel”
Reviews.Author: Oldham74
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend & i stayed here for 3 nights during our road trip around USA & Canada. We had a coupon which steered us towards it as it is quite a drive from the 'touristy' parts of LA & we were not dissapointed. The room was very clean & well presented with a good sized comfortable bed & a decent bathroom. We were on the 3rd floor but thankfully they have lifts/elevators.There is a nice cool pool which was very welcome after we had walked upto the 'Hollywood' sign & around the Observatory on a hot summers day. If you don't mind the drive it is well worth considering, especially if you have a coupon. No breakfast included though.

Reviews.Title: “Bring Ear Plugs”
Reviews.Author: mixologist5
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night, rooms are clean & the staff is friendly. IF and only IF you plan on sleeping, bring ear plugs or find another place to stay. I don't know what was worse, the noisy toilet...the fridge cycling cool air every ten minutes...the thin walls so evry conversation in adjoining rooms, stairway & parking lot could be heard...the cars traveling along the 405...car alarms...fire trucks...OR maybe it was the garbage truck at 4:45am that sounded like a roadside bomb going off. NEVER again will I stay here, I'd rather drive a bit further and get some gosh darn peace and quite!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a good position”
Reviews.Author: melbermar
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Best Western Carriage Inn for 8 days in October/November of this year. The first good surprise was the fantastic weather (in the 30s) every day; something we had not expected so late in the year. California, in general, was great. Beautiful beaches, wide, clean roads and friendly people. Expensive though - especially since the pound collapsed! The Best Western was also a pleasant surpise. We had expected a very basic motel with few amenities, however the rooms were very large with plenty of storage space and coffee making equipment. Irons and ironing boards were provided and they were kept immaculately clean. The beds were extremely comfortable and changed daily. There was also free internet access in reception, a nice pool and spa area with towels provided. The fact that Denny's restaurant was next door was also a bonus. The staff were pleasant and eager to help in any way. They had printed sheets with directions to attractions and local restaurants which they handed out on request. The hotel itself is very well-situated for the most popular attractions. All in all we had a very comfortable stay and would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: Bevdoll5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights at the start of September and it more than exceeded our expectations. Hotel is easy to find and has great access to the 405 and 101 highways. It is within easy driving distance of Universal Studios, Bevely Hills, Chinese Theatre, Dodgers Stadium etc. Rooms are a good size with plenty of free parking. Hotel staff were very helpful and gave us a sheet with driving directions to all the main attractions in LA, as well as a sheet of restaurants in the area. We didn't ask for this but it was extremely helpful and a very thoughtful thing to do. There is also a computer in reception with free access to the internet which we found useful if you don't have a laptop to use internet in the room. I would definitely recommend this hotel as a base for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Very Suitable and Pleasant!”
Reviews.Author: TravelJunkie2579
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 10 days while we were doing some martial arts training in Sherman Oaks. We were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The Staff was immediately friendly when we checked in and although we had a problem with our key at first, they fixed it quickly. You can tell this is an older hotel but it has been updated and is kept very clean and tidy. The room service was polite and did their best even among the mess we created in the room. I left valubles out by accident but nothing was stolen. The onsite Denny's was a plus and we visited often. We had a problem with the vending machines but the front desk quickly and happily refunded our money. There was also a Target and a Ralphs within easy driving distance which came in handy. The Galleria was not far down the road and had an abundance of restraunts and a movie theater. The hotel is right off of the freeway and very accessible. Being to girls, we felt VERY safe here, even when we were walking around at night. The pool and laundry room were also kept very clean. Bring quarters if you want to do laundry! The beds were very comfy!!! The wi-fi was very accessible and we had no problems with it. We found the hotel a perfect place to crash after many long days of training! I highly suggest it to all travelers, just make sure you have a car!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Clean But Check the Room First”
Reviews.Author: CafeLady
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of its location -- close to the Encino-Tarzana Regional Medical Center where my daughter was having surgery -- and based on favorable reviews on TripAdvisor. Great shops on Ventura Boulevard and the Sherman Oaks Galleria are nearby. This is really a motel, with exterior walkways, and no elevators to the second floor. Since I was traveling alone, I asked for a room on the first floor to save me from lugging my suitcase up the steps. I was first given a room in a remote corner of the property, off the main walkway in a dark secluded area. When I entered the room, it felt damp and smelled musty. I returned to the front desk, and explained to the clerk that I didn't feel safe in that room. He was very nice, and explained that they only had a second floor unit available, but it was right across from the office. Given the other option, I agreed to stay in the 2nd floor room. It was a much nicer room, smelled cleaned, well lit and I did feel safer to be close to the office. Service from the hotel staff was mixed. Before I booked the room, I called to confirm close proximity to the hospital. The clerk responded by telling me he had no idea if they were near the hospital and didn't offer to check for me. When I asked if he could take my reservation over the phone, he suggested it would be faster if I did it myself online. I probably would have then looked for another hotel, but I was making last minute plans and had no time for more research. The first clerk that checked me in was curt and didn't seem interested in my needs, but the clerk who assigned me the second room was very pleasant and seemed concerned that I felt safe. Although I didn't get a chance to use it, the outdoor pool looked nice and was busy but not crowded. The hotel is attached to a Dennys so breakfast is convenient. Room service is delivered by Dennys as well although the selection was very limited. The room was clean the the bed was very comfortable. Wireless Internet worked well but cost extra. Express checkout would have been more convenient since only one clerk was staffing the desk.

Reviews.Title: “Use to be worth the prices but now..No WAY!”
Reviews.Author: pulgadelmundo
Reviews.Content: This use to be one of my fave hotels in the area ( not too many decent ones in the area because all the hotels north of this one are seedy and are known by locals for the Van Nuys hooks that walk north of Burbank...aka don't book anything in Van Nuys if you can avoid it...( One of the last time there while smoking a ciggie with a friend in his truck, a guy cam up to us and said "Where the [--] at?" obviously looking along that strip north Yes, The rooms are clean, nice large overall and the only major problem I have experienced on my many stays is the inconsistant hot water which has at times been ICEcold) but I liked the location close to the Galleria. BUT NOW The hotel has now outrageously raised their rates...You use tobe able toget a room for 100 with your AAA and now it is 149 with your AAA...just isn't worth the price. The only other descent option is The nearby Courtyard off Ventura but they are usually 200 + so alas I will end up either moving north or south on my future work related journeys to the Valley ( see my review of the Holiday Inn)

Reviews.Title: “it's an alright 2.5 star”
Reviews.Author: luxorgoods
Reviews.Content: it was a bastic motor inn. i felt safe and the room was clean. very no thrills. the poeple in the front office seemed nice

Reviews.Title: “Great Place !!!”
Reviews.Author: dodat
Reviews.Content: very nice place to stay !!!! I vote # 1 in my book,the hotel was very nice and claen we stayed at Best Western Carraige inn in Sherman Oaks July 30, 2007 the staff was awesome and very helpful,the room had a fridge,microwave. and a reasonable place to eat at Denny's on site food was good and delivered to the room,if I was to go back Best Western will be the only place I would stay ,keep up the good work... Atl.ga

Reviews.Title: “great value very clean~”
Reviews.Author: trippinduke
Reviews.Content: Pet Friendly, nice place! The people working here are all sweet. For the area it is a great value and you can park your car right in front of your room. On-site laundry was clean and inexpensive. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Carriage Inn is GREAT and a GREAT VALUE.”
Reviews.Author: deabad
Reviews.Content: Stayed again last week. The hotel personnel went out of their way to make sure our stay was wonderful. THEY make this an EXCELLENT choice for the money. The rooms are nice and clean, the location is very convenient. It is next to the 405 freeway, so request a quiet room away from the highway. Dennys (yuck) next door, so eat elsewhere. We'll be at the Carriage Inn again this weekend ... and of course at our favorite Italian restaurant too ... ... Spumoni, at 14533 Ventura Blvd.

Reviews.Title: “Standard 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: l0v2trav3l
Reviews.Content: Having never been to LA and wanting to stay near a friend in Sherman Oaks my mom and I decided to book this hotel...mainly because we've experienced Best Westerns out East and we wanted something familiar. We stayed here May 6-13, 2006, we booked online. Our trip's purpose was to sightsee! Reception was fine, not reallllly friendly but did their job. They called our room promptly to let us know Mom's luggage had arrived the 2nd night we were there (airline lost it). Pool - never used it. Didn't see too many in it - I guess it wasn't really that hot out. The 405 and Sepelveda Blvd. is noisy - didn't bother us, we're used to it. What annoyed me more was the air conditioner noise...couldn't hear the TV! Our room was right beside one of the glass doors to the outside, on the 3rd floor. It was noisy when late arrivals would be staggering to their rooms after a night of drinking. It wasn't the end of the world though. We booked a Starline Tour - was picked up at the reception desk no problem. We rented a car for the week, parked in the lot with no problems - it was a bit busy though. All in all it was decent for the price. Hotel rooms are generally gross if you ask me (a germophob) so if I lived it for a week I'm sure you can. :)

Reviews.Title: “horrid”
Reviews.Author: Mademoiselle117
Reviews.Content: honestly, Im a pretty tolerant person. This hotel was absolutley terrible. For starters, this property is described as a three star hotel. not only is is not a hotel, but a motel, it is far from the three star quality that I have seen in the past. My mother has a slight handicap, and not only was there no handicap parking by our room, there was not enough parking. period. They did not serve us with the accomodations that we requested, at all ( i. e, handicap accessible room) The pillows in the room smelled, and the seal on the door was broken, causing the cool air to rish in under the door. Additionally, the way that the floors are set up is so confusing! The elevator buttons only go up to 3, but we were told the third floor, is actually, the fifth floor. what!? well, after one night, we checked out. it was awful beyond belief. DO NOT STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your earplugs”
Reviews.Author: jaf006
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Carriage Inn is in a good location for access to I405 and US101 at the southern end of the San Fernando Valley. You can also use Sepulveda Blvd to go down into the L.A. basin, or Victory Blvd to go East/West in the Valley. I spent 10 nights in this motel on a recent business trip. The room was kept clean, the bed (a King) was comfortable. There was a small fridge and no microwave oven. Because of the extreme heat during my stay, the wall air conditioner ran 24 hours a day. The noise from that, and the very noisy Sepulveda Blvd. (a fire station down the street) and motel parking lot were definite downers. There appeared to be only one ice machine for the motel, located in the parking area, but at least it always had ice when I needed it. Although there is a Denney's attached to the motel, I don't recommend it if you want good and speedy service. Other dining options are at least a mile away. The cable TV offerings were meager, and the WiFi connection was poor at times. The room rate seemed fair for the facility, and the front counter staff was always helpful. Would I stay there again? Only if absolutely necessary for business, never for a personal trip.

Reviews.Title: “Short and Sweet..”
Reviews.Author: Somer2
Reviews.Content: My family had a wonderful short 3 day stay at this hotel. The room was clean, had a pillow top mattress & the staff was very accomodating. We slept well. For the price, its a great value for visiting the L.A. sights just 7 miles away. Universal, Hollywood walk etc. Very busy hotel during peak season. Our breakfasts at Denny's were very good each morning. I would recommend a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money business hotel”
Reviews.Author: MusicGuy
Reviews.Content: Clean, large rooms (especially the newly renovated ones), and excellent value for money in an expensive city. Centrally located to shopping and sights, and with a Denny's on the location. Free high speed internet, adequate parking - everything the business traveller needs. Only downside was a noisy bunch of bikinied girls in the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Should be renamed Worst Western”
Reviews.Author: likeniceplaces
Reviews.Content: To start out, don't believe the website that says you get a continental breakfast. You get coupons for breakfast at an adjacent Denny's where the service is so bad, unless you want to waste your morning on a crummy breakfast, you won't bother using the coupons. I heard numerous people complaining about it when I went to the "lobby" to complain that my room hadn't been cleaned btween 8AM when I left the hotel and 3:30PM when I returned. Rather than apologise for the inconvenience, a surly clerk told me that they were really busy. This was a Wednesday, in the beginning of May, not exactly high season for any hotel. Besides, the parking lot wasn't even crowded. After waiting 30 minutes to get my room cleaned, I asked how much longer this was going to take to which a different surly clerk answered, "I don't know, I've never cleaned a room". At the conclusion of my stay, I wrote to Best Western via their website to issue my complaint. For that, I received a letter from the hotel manager with NO apology, reiteration "we were really busy", and if I wanted my room made up early, I should have asked at the desk. I didn't know 3:30PM was early. She also said if I contact her personally, she'll make sure my next stay is good. No way will I or any one I can tell stay at this dump again. It will make me think twice before staying at ANY Best Western.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Carriage Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 5525 Sepulveda Boulevard, Los Angeles, CA 91411
